intro: Chlidanthus, commonly known as the desert willow, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, willow-like branches and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink, purple, and white. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is adapted to hot, dry climates and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
